literaryContext.chapterSignificance: Famous opening; Ishmael's reasons for going to sea
literaryContext.passageDescription: "Call me Ishmael" - narrator explains his need for sea as alternative to suicide
literaryContext.literarySignificance: Establishes Ishmael as unreliable but compelling narrator. His depression and search for meaning drives the telling.

expectedFeatures.rationale: Ishmael only knows his own reasons
His "damp, drizzly November in my soul"

commitment_irreversibility.notes: Strong evidence of commitment to negative emotions and a decision to take action (getting to sea) to alleviate it.
